channel.title: Vercel-Blog on Daily Tech Articles Feed
channel.description: Recent content in Vercel-Blog on Daily Tech Articles Feed

item.title: A more flexible Pro plan for modern teams
item.description: üöÄ Vercel is enhancing its Pro plan to better support modern team collaboration and evolving workloads, including those driven by AI. Key updates aim to align with how applications now consume infrastructure. Stay tuned for a more flexible approach to managing your projects! #Vercel #ProPlan #TeamCollaboration #AI #Infrastructure

item.title: Free Viewer seats now available on Pro
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for Pro teams! You can now add unlimited Viewer seats at no extra cost. This allows team members to collaborate more flexibly without affecting your budget. Viewers can access project dashboards, deployments, and analytics but can’t change production settings or see sensitive data. Developer seats remain at $20, while Viewer seats are free. Team members can easily request upgrades from owners directly in the dashboard. #ProUpdates #TeamCollaboration #ViewerSeats #CostEfficient…

item.title: HIPAA BAAs are now available to Pro teams
item.description: Pro teams can now enter into a Business Associate Agreement (BAA) on Vercel, supporting HIPAA-compliant workloads without needing an Enterprise contract. Vercel ensures HIPAA compliance through technical safeguards, annual audits, and breach notifications. However, compliance is a shared responsibility; teams must manage security features and access. This update simplifies regulatory compliance for healthcare applications. #HIPAA #Vercel #HealthcareTech #DataSecurity #ProTeams üè•üîíüìä

item.title: Included Pro usage is now credit-based
item.description: üöÄ Big news for Pro users! The Pro plan now features a $20 monthly usage credit, replacing fixed allocations with a flexible system that adjusts to your workload. This update enhances your experience by allowing better management of resources. Additional benefits include free viewer seats, self-serve enterprise features like SAML SSO and HIPAA BA, and improved spend management. #ProPlan #UsageCredit #TechUpdates #EnterpriseFeatures #FlexibleSystem

item.title: No build queues: On-demand concurrent builds now on by default
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for teams on the new Pro pricing model! On-demand concurrent builds are now enabled by default, allowing builds to start immediately across projects without queue delays. This applies unless multiple builds target the same Git branch. Teams can manage this setting anytime with the new bulk enable feature, even if not yet on the Pro model. Learn more about these updates and the Pro pricing switch in the documentation! #BuildAutomation #ProPricing #DevOps #SoftwareDevelopment

item.title: Spend Management now enabled by default on Pro
item.description: üöÄ Spend Management is now the default for all Pro teams! New Pro teams will have a budget set based on previous usage, while existing teams will see no changes to their current budgets. You‚Äôll receive email alerts when approaching your spend threshold, helping you manage costs effectively. Adjust settings anytime for flexibility. Stay informed and optimize your spending! #SpendManagement #ProTeams #CostControl #Budgeting #BusinessUpdates

item.title: AI SDK and AI Gateway now integrated in GitHub Actions
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! The new integration of the AI SDK and AI Gateway with GitHub Actions allows users to access the vercel/ai-action@v2. This feature enables the generation of text or structured JSON directly within workflows by specifying prompts, models, and API keys. This opens up various AI-powered use cases, such as summarizing release notes, conducting light PR code reviews, moderating comments, and identifying duplicate issues. Explore more in the GitHub Actions marketplace…

item.title: Bulk enable on-demand concurrent builds across projects
item.description: Pro teams can now enhance efficiency by bulk enabling on-demand concurrent builds across all projects with a single click. üîÑ This feature allows builds to start immediately upon request, optimizing compute capacity, except when multiple builds target the same Git branch. To activate this, visit your Pro team’s billing settings to enable or disable it for existing projects or select specific projects. Learn more in the documentation! üìÑüíª #BuildAutomation #DevOps #ProjectManagement #TechUpdates

item.title: Critical npm supply chain attack response - September 8, 2025
item.description: On September 8, 2025, a supply chain attack impacted 18 popular npm packages, including chalk, debug, and ansi-styles. These packages had malicious code aimed at intercepting cryptocurrency transactions in browsers. üö® Our security and engineering teams responded by identifying the affected projects and purging build caches. Affected customers have been notified with specific guidance. üîçüîí #CyberSecurity #npm #SupplyChainAttack #Cryptocurrency #Malware

item.title: Vercel Functions now support graceful shutdown
item.description: üöÄ Vercel Functions now enhance Node.js and Python runtimes with graceful shutdown support! This feature allows up to 500 milliseconds for running cleanup tasks before termination. When a function is terminated, a SIGTERM signal can be used to manage essential tasks like closing database connections or flushing logs. Learn more about the benefits of this update! #Vercel #NodeJS #Python #WebDevelopment #Serverless

item.title: Export traces, web analytics events, and speed insights datapoints to any destination
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for Vercel users! You can now export OpenTelemetry traces, Web Analytics events, and Speed Insights data to any third-party tool. This enhancement allows streaming of more raw data through expanded Log Drains infrastructure. Pro and Enterprise teams can set custom HTTP endpoints and choose from various encodings like JSON, NDJSON, or Protobuf. Explore Vercel Drains today! #Vercel #DataExport #WebAnalytics #OpenTelemetry #TechUpdates

item.title: Export traces, web analytics events, and speed insights datapoints to any destination
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Vercel now allows users to export OpenTelemetry traces, Web Analytics events, and Speed Insights data to any third-party tool. This enhancement expands the Log Drains infrastructure for seamless data streaming. Users can set up custom HTTP endpoints to receive data in various formats like JSON, NDJSON, or Protobuf. Pro and Enterprise teams can export data at a cost of $0.50 per GB. Learn more about Vercel Drains! #DataExport #WebAnalytics #Vercel #OpenTelemetry…

item.title: Zero-configuration Express backends
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Express, the minimalist web framework for Node.js, now offers zero-configuration support on Vercel. This means you can deploy Express applications without the hassle of setting up redirects in vercel.json or using the /api folder. For a seamless experience, check out the Express on Vercel documentation. #NodeJS #Express #Vercel #WebDevelopment #Programming

item.title: Moonshot AI's Kimi K2 0905 model is now supported in Vercel AI Gateway
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Moonshot AI’s Kimi K2 0905 model is now accessible through Vercel AI Gateway. This model supports agentic coding with a 256K context window and requires no additional provider accounts. AI Gateway offers a unified API for tracking usage, costs, and optimizing performance. It includes built-in observability and intelligent routing for enhanced reliability. To get started, install the AI SDK v5 and set the model to moonshotai/kimi-k2-0905. #AI #MoonshotAI #Vercel…

item.title: Stress testing Biome's noFloatingPromises lint rule
item.description: We recently collaborated with the Biome team to enhance their noFloatingPromises lint rule. This rule is crucial for identifying unhandled Promises that can lead to errors. To test its effectiveness, we organized a friendly competition to create challenging test cases that could still pass the updated lint rule. This initiative not only fostered creativity but also encouraged learning among our team. Stay tuned for more insights! üöÄüí° #SoftwareDevelopment #LintRules #Teamwork #Innovation…

item.title: Open SDK strategy
item.description: At Vercel, open source is a core principle. They focus on developing high-quality software without the goal of profit. Their approach aims to enhance the overall software landscape for everyone, not just their customers. This philosophy reflects the belief that improving software benefits all users. Learn more about Vercel’s commitment to open source. üåçüíª #OpenSource #SoftwareDevelopment #Vercel #TechCommunity #Innovation

item.title: CVE-2025-55173
item.description: üö® A vulnerability (CVE-2025-55173) affecting Next.js Image Optimization has been identified. It impacts versions prior to v15.4.5 and v14.2.31, allowing attacker-controlled external image servers to trigger arbitrary file downloads. This could lead to phishing and social engineering attacks. A patch was released on July 29th, 2025, addressing this issue for Vercel customers. For more details, check the GitHub Advisory and Next.js Release Notes. #CyberSecurity #NextJS #Vulnerability…

item.title: CVE-2025-57752
item.description: A vulnerability, CVE-2025-57752, has been identified in Next.js Image Optimization affecting versions prior to v15.4.5 and v14.2.31. It involved cache poisoning, risking unauthorized access to sensitive images. The issue arose when API routes returned images based on headers, leading to potential disclosure of user-specific content. The vulnerability has been resolved in the latest versions, ensuring that request headers are not forwarded to image endpoints. For more details, refer to the…

item.title: CVE-2025-57822
item.description: A recent vulnerability, CVE-2025-57822, has been identified in Next.js Middleware, affecting versions before v14.2.32 and v15.4.7. This flaw allowed for Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) risks due to misconfigured NextResponse.next() usage. Applications that reflected user request headers could unintentionally allow servers to make requests to harmful destinations. A patch was released on August 25, 2025, to protect Vercel customers. For those unable to upgrade, it is vital to adhere to…

item.title: Preparing for the worst: Our core database failover test
item.description: On July 24, 2025, we conducted a successful failover test of our core control-plane database from Azure West US to East US 2. This exercise confirmed our disaster recovery plans in real-world conditions. All control-plane traffic was tested, ensuring stability without any customer impact. While preview and development traffic were affected, our production CDN traffic remained unaffected across 19 regions. The operation highlighted our commitment to resilience, achieving zero downtime and no…

item.title: Anomaly alerts now in limited beta for Enterprise customers
item.description: üö® Enterprise customers can now access anomaly alerts in limited beta! These alerts help quickly identify unusual patterns in application metrics, allowing for prompt issue resolution. Users can integrate alerts via webhooks into existing monitoring systems and receive notifications directly in Slack channels. Explore this feature with Observability Plus and streamline your monitoring process! #AnomalyDetection #EnterpriseSolutions #MonitoringAlerts #TechUpdates #ObservabilityPlus

item.title: Deploy Slack's Bolt.js to Vercel with @vercel/slack-bolt
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! @vercel has released @vercel/slack-bolt, an adapter that allows you to deploy Slack’s Bolt for JavaScript on Vercel’s AI Cloud. This tool helps manage Slack webhook events efficiently. It addresses the challenge of responding within three seconds to avoid timeouts, using Fluid compute‚Äôs streaming feature. Compatible with any function or framework like Hono, Nitro, or Next.js, you can start with the Slack Agent Template or explore the library on npm. #Slack…

item.title: s1ngularity: supply chain attack in Nx packages
item.description: üö® A supply chain attack has targeted the Nx package in the npm registry. Malicious versions were published using a stolen npm token, leading to potential exfiltration of developer credentials. üîç The Nx team quickly removed the compromised packages, but Vercel customers are generally safe unless specific conditions were met. üëâ For detailed information, visit the GitHub advisory from the Nx team. Stay vigilant! #SupplyChainAttack #CyberSecurity #NxPackages #Vercel #DeveloperSafety

item.title: 30-day runtime log retention, now available in Observability Plus
item.description: üìä Exciting news for Observability Plus users! Teams can now access 30 days of runtime log retention, which includes valuable details on requests, Vercel Functions, and cache activity. This feature allows you to view, query, and share up to 14 consecutive days of log data at once. Best of all, this extended retention comes at no extra cost for Pro and Enterprise plans! Learn more about Runtime Logs and how to utilize this feature. #ObservabilityPlus #LogRetention #DataInsights

item.title: Devin, Raycast, Windsurf, and Goose now supported on Vercel MCP
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! You can now integrate Devin, Raycast, Windsurf, and Goose with Vercel’s Model Context Protocol (MCP). This allows for secure access to AI clients approved by Vercel. To get started, follow the installation steps for each client. Discover how to enhance your projects with Vercel MCP! #Vercel #AIIntegration #WebDevelopment #TechNews

item.title: AI-powered prototyping with design systems
item.description: Unlocking the potential of AI in prototyping means speeding up collaboration and maintaining brand consistency. While many AI tools excel in speed and teamwork, they often fall short in producing on-brand designs. This gap arises from a lack of context about design components. To bridge this gap, a design system tailored for AI can help create prototypes that are both brand-aware and production-ready. Discover how to enhance your prototyping process! #AIDesign #Prototyping #DesignSystems…

item.title: Deploy xmcp servers with zero-configuration
item.description: üöÄ Vercel now supports xmcp, a framework for building MCP servers using TypeScript with zero configuration. üìÅ It utilizes file-based routing, making it easy to develop tools for your MCP server. You can create tools simply by adding a file with a default export. üõ†Ô∏è Learn more about deploying xmcp to Vercel in the documentation. #Vercel #xmcp #TypeScript #WebDevelopment #MCPServers

item.title: AI Gateway is now generally available
item.description: üöÄ AI Gateway is now available! This new tool offers a unified API to access hundreds of AI models with features like transparent pricing and built-in observability. Key benefits include sub-20ms latency, automatic failover, and detailed usage analytics. You can use the AI SDK or an OpenAI-compatible endpoint to get started quickly. Discover more about AI Gateway today! #AIGateway #AIModels #TechNews #Innovation #APIs

item.title: AI Gateway: Production-ready reliability for your AI apps
item.description: üöÄ Building AI apps just got easier! With tools like the AI SDK, developers can create both frontends and backends in minutes. However, moving to production poses challenges, especially with reliability. Connecting to a single LLM provider can create risks if that provider faces downtime or rate limits. Introducing AI Gateway: it ensures consistent availability and stability for AI workloads, having already supported millions of users. #AIGateway #AIApps #TechInnovation #Reliability…

item.title: Introducing Streamdown: Open source Markdown for AI streaming
item.description: üöÄ Introducing Streamdown: a new open-source Markdown renderer tailored for AI streaming! Streamdown enhances the AI Elements Response component and can also function as a standalone option for developers. It effectively manages unterminated chunks, interactive code blocks, and math expressions. Key features include: - Tailwind typography styles - GitHub Flavored Markdown support - Interactive code blocks with Shiki highlighting - LaTeX math support - Enhanced security for untrusted content…

item.title: <script type="text/llms.txt">
item.description: Discover a new approach for AI agents interacting with protected pages. The emerging standard, llms.txt, proposes including instructions directly in HTML responses using the <script type="text/llms.txt"> tag. This could simplify how AIs access and consume documentation without relying on external sources. Learn more about this innovative concept! üíªüìÑ #AI #HTML #llms #Innovation #TechNews

item.title: Rethinking prototyping, requirements, and project delivery at Code and Theory
item.description: Code and Theory is a digital agency that integrates strategy, design, and engineering. Their team consists of equal parts creatives and engineers, working on projects for major brands like Microsoft and Amazon. They focus on creating scalable digital experiences and utilize a method called v0 to streamline the process from concept to functioning software. Learn more about their innovative approach! üåêüíª #DigitalAgency #Prototyping #Innovation #Tech #ProjectDelivery

item.title: Agents can now access protected deployments via Vercel‚Äôs MCP server
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Vercel has introduced two new tools in its MCP server. The get_access_to_vercel_url feature allows agents to generate a temporary shareable URL, enabling access to Vercel Auth-protected deployments without login credentials. Additionally, the web_fetch_vercel_url tool lets agents fetch content directly from protected deployments, even when access would normally be denied. Explore these features to streamline your development process! #Vercel…

item.title: Node.js Vercel Functions now support fetch web handlers
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Vercel Functions on the Node.js runtime now support fetch web handlers. This enhancement boosts interoperability across various JavaScript frameworks and runtimes. You can still choose to export individual HTTP methods if that suits your project better. For further details, check out the documentation! üìö #NodeJS #Vercel #WebDevelopment #JavaScript #APIs

item.title: If agents are building your app, who gets the W-2?
item.description: Autonomous coding agents are changing the software development landscape. ü§ñ These agents can now fully design, build, test, and deploy features without human intervention. However, current U.S. GAAP regulations have not fully adapted to this technology. While third-party software costs can be capitalized, developer tools are often classified as overhead. It’s essential to consider how to treat work done by these agents in a manner similar to salaried engineers. #SoftwareDevelopment…

item.title: Native support for SvelteKit's new OpenTelemetry spans
item.description: üöÄ Vercel has added native support for SvelteKit’s new server-side OpenTelemetry spans. To begin, users can activate experimental tracing in SvelteKit and set up a tracing instrumentation file with the Vercel OpenTelemetry collector. Generated traces will now include built-in SvelteKit spans, and other collectors can also be configured. For further details, check the SvelteKit observability documentation. üìä #SvelteKit #OpenTelemetry #Vercel #WebDevelopment #Observability

item.title: Vercel Sandbox increases concurrency and port limits
item.description: üöÄ Vercel has enhanced its Sandbox capabilities for Pro and Enterprise teams! Now, users can run up to 2,000 Sandboxes concurrently, a significant increase from the previous limit of 150. Each Sandbox can also expose up to 4 ports for external access. This improvement allows for better handling of traffic spikes, untrusted code execution, and more complex applications. For projects needing even higher limits, contacting the sales team is an option. Learn more in the Vercel Sandbox docs! üìäüîß…

item.title: Improved fake hardware detection with Vercel BotID
item.description: Vercel has enhanced its BotID Deep Analysis with an updated detection model. This improvement expands fingerprinting coverage for headless browsers and simulated device hardware, allowing for better identification of advanced bots. The upgraded model works in real-time without disrupting genuine users. Current users can benefit from these updates immediately by upgrading to botid@1.5.2. üîçü§ñüöÄ #BotID #CyberSecurity #TechUpdate

item.title: How Coxwave delivers GenAI value faster with Vercel
item.description: Coxwave is revolutionizing the development of GenAI products for enterprises. üöÄ Their consulting arm, AX, and analytics platform, Align, serve leading companies like Anthropic, Meta, Microsoft, and PwC. Since 2021, Coxwave has focused on speed‚Äînot just in model performance, but in iteration and value delivery. To enhance their web app strategy, they utilized Next.js and Vercel, enabling quicker results for their clients. #GenAI #Coxwave #Nextjs #Vercel #TechInnovation

item.title: Introducing the Runtime Cache API
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Vercel has launched the Runtime Cache API, allowing you to store and retrieve data seamlessly across Functions, Routing Middleware, and Builds within the same region. This ephemeral cache offers tag-based invalidation for better cache management. You can monitor performance metrics like hit rates and storage usage in the Observability dashboard. Keep in mind, reads and writes are billed regionally based on your runtime area. Learn more in the documentation! üìä…

item.title: The real serverless compute to database connection problem, solved
item.description: The article addresses a common misconception about serverless compute and its connection to traditional databases. It highlights that the challenge lies not in the number of connections during normal operation but in potential connection leaks when serverless functions are suspended. The piece provides clarity on the actual cause and offers a simple solution to this issue. üîçüíªüîó #Serverless #Database #TechSolutions #CloudComputing #SoftwareDevelopment

item.title: The three types of AI bot traffic and how to handle them
item.description: AI bot traffic is on the rise, and recent data identifies three types of AI-driven crawlers. These bots can enhance discoverability but may disrupt teams if not managed properly. ü§ñ Understanding the role of these crawlers is vital. While some bots are beneficial, blocking them could lead to missed opportunities, similar to restricting early search engines. üåê As user behavior shifts towards seeking direct answers, sites that strategically manage bot access will gain a competitive edge. #AIBots…

item.title: Auto-recharge available in AI Gateway
item.description: üöÄ Great news for Vercel users! The AI Gateway now offers an auto-recharge feature. This allows for automatic credit top-ups, ensuring your apps run smoothly without interruptions. You can easily enable or adjust this feature in the AI Gateway dashboard. Set your preferred top-up amount, trigger balance, and even a monthly spend limit to manage your credits efficiently. Learn more about this update! #Vercel #AIGateway #AutoRecharge #WebDevelopment #TechUpdates

item.title: Claude Sonnet 4 now supports 1M token context in Vercel AI Gateway
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Claude Sonnet 4 now offers a 1 million-token context window through Vercel’s AI Gateway. This enhancement allows for larger inputs, such as extensive codebases and document sets. With a unified API, users can easily manage performance optimizations and track usage. The AI Gateway also supports built-in observability and intelligent provider routing for reliability. For implementation, simply install the AI SDK v5 and set up the model. #AI #Vercel #ClaudeSonnet4…

item.title: Cutting delivery times in half with v0
item.description: Ready.net is enhancing utility company operations with its new feature, v0. This platform streamlines the process for managing financing and compliance with state-level stakeholders. Faced with urgent and often unclear requirements, Ready.net needed a solution to accelerate ideation, validation, and delivery. v0 is designed to cut delivery times significantly, supporting three teams with limited design resources. Learn more about this innovative approach! üöÄ‚ö°Ô∏è #UtilityManagement #Innovation…

item.title: Vercel BotID now leverages Vercel's verified bot directory
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! With the release of BotID 1.5.0, you can now access Vercel’s verified bot directory for deeper insights. This update enhances real-time detection of verified bots, allowing for secure programmatic decisions. The Deep Analysis mode provides key information like source IP range and user-agent validation, helping teams manage bot interactions effectively. Discover how BotID can improve your workflow! #BotID #Vercel #WebDevelopment #TechUpdates #Bots ü§ñ

item.title: Vercel's bot verification now supports Web Bot Auth
item.description: üöÄ Vercel has enhanced its bot verification system by supporting Web Bot Auth, developed through collaboration with industry partners. This new protocol uses HTTP Message Signatures for verifying traffic from various automated sources. It helps maintain a curated directory of verified bots, ensuring legitimate ones access your site while blocking spoofed bots. Web Bot Auth uses public-key cryptography to authenticate bots, including popular tools like SEO crawlers and AI bots. Notably,…

item.title: Add context when using Instant Rollback
item.description: üöÄ New feature alert! You can now add context when performing an Instant Rollback. This allows you to include a reason visible to your team in the project overview. You can even incorporate links or notes for clarity. Plus, updates can be made at any time! Learn more about enhancing your rollback process. #InstantRollback #ProjectManagement #TeamCollaboration #TechUpdates

item.title: v0.dev -> v0.app
item.description: Transform your ideas into deployed apps with ease using v0.app! üöÄ With just one prompt, v0 streamlines the process by providing UI, content, backend, and logic. It also offers support for research, debugging, and planning. From product managers to recruiters, v0 is revolutionizing team operations. #AppDevelopment #TechInnovation #Teamwork #Productivity #v0app

item.title: Cursor now supported on Vercel MCP
item.description: üöÄ Great news for developers! Cursor is now compatible with Vercel’s Model Context Protocol (MCP). With this integration, you can easily explore projects, inspect deployments, and fetch logs directly from Cursor. üîç To get started, simply follow the one-click setup or update your .cursor/mcp.json file. A Vercel account login will be required. Learn more about using Cursor with Vercel MCP! #Vercel #Cursor #DevTools #MCP #SoftwareDevelopment

item.title: Bulk upgrade deprecated Node.js versions
item.description: üöÄ Upgrade your Node.js projects easily! Team owners can now update all projects using Node.js 18 or earlier to Node.js 22 with just one click in the Vercel Dashboard. Remember, if your project specifies a version in package.json, you’ll need to update it manually. Existing deployments remain unaffected. Check out your deprecated Node.js projects today! #Nodejs #Vercel #TechUpdate #WebDevelopment #SoftwareEngineering

item.title: How Zapier scales product partnerships with v0
item.description: üöÄ Zapier is enhancing product partnerships with its v0 tool, streamlining how SaaS and AI companies can integrate automation. This innovation allows partners to embed Zapier’s automation engine directly into their products without extensive in-house integration work. With v0, the Powered by Zapier team can now create high-fidelity demos in just hours, leading to quicker implementation and more integrations. #Automation #Partnerships #SaaS #Innovation #AI

item.title: Improved metrics search in Observability Plus
item.description: üöÄ Exciting updates in Vercel Observability! The metrics search and navigation experience has been enhanced. You can now quickly find metrics using partial names or abbreviations like TTFB (time to first byte). Additional features include a side-by-side view of all metrics for an event, keyboard shortcuts for faster navigation, and a mobile-optimized interface. These updates are available now for all teams using Observability Plus. #Vercel #Observability #TechUpdates #Metrics #Productivity

item.title: vlt is now available in builds via zero configuration
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Vercel now supports the vlt package manager for builds without the need for configuration. üìÇ Projects with a vlt-lock.json file will automatically execute vlt install as the default Install Command. üîß Note: vlt requires Node 20.x and is available only in the modern build image. Learn more about this new feature on Vercel! #Vercel #vlt #WebDevelopment #PackageManager #TechNews

item.title: GPT-5, GPT-5-mini, and GPT-5-nano are now available in Vercel AI Gateway
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news! OpenAI’s GPT-5, GPT-5-mini, and GPT-5-nano are now accessible via Vercel AI Gateway. This platform allows seamless model integration without needing multiple provider accounts. Users can easily track usage, costs, and optimize performance. To get started, install the AI SDK v5 and select your preferred model. Explore more about the AI Gateway and its features! üåê‚ú® #OpenAI #Vercel #AIGateway #GPT5 #TechUpdates

item.title: Vercel collaborates with OpenAI for GPT-5 launch
item.description: üöÄ Vercel has partnered with OpenAI to launch the GPT-5 family of models! These models are now available through AI Gateway and in production on v0.dev. Vercel has been testing GPT-5 in various environments, and the results indicate improved frontend design capabilities. GPT-5 generates clean, composable code and enhances workflows, particularly with long-context reasoning and tool handling. Vercel is already integrating GPT-5 into its dashboard and other applications. #Vercel #OpenAI #GPT5…

item.title: Vercel is the only vendor to be recognized as a Visionary in the 2025 Gartner¬Æ Magic Quadrant‚Ñ¢ for Cloud-Native Application Platforms
item.description: üåê Vercel has been recognized as a Visionary in the 2025 Gartner¬Æ Magic Quadrant‚Ñ¢ for Cloud-Native Application Platforms. With over 4M weekly active domains and 115B requests served, Vercel‚Äôs AI Cloud empowers teams to create fast and secure applications effortlessly. This acknowledgment underscores Vercel’s role in shaping the future of web development. #CloudComputing #Gartner #WebDevelopment #Vercel #Innovation

item.title: Introducing AI Elements: build AI interfaces faster
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for frontend engineers! Vercel has launched AI Elements, a tool designed to simplify the process of building AI interfaces. With this new product, developers can create ChatGPT or v0-like interfaces in just minutes. This innovation aims to streamline the app-building process, allowing teams to focus on functionality over design complexity. #AIElements #Vercel #FrontendDevelopment #TechInnovation #AIInterfaces

item.title: Introducing AI Elements: Prebuilt, composable AI SDK components
item.description: üöÄ Introducing AI Elements, a new open-source library designed for customizable React components! Built on shadcn/ui, it allows developers to create interfaces using the Vercel AI SDK. Key features include control over UI elements like message threads and input boxes. To get started, simply initialize with our CLI, choose your components, and begin building. For detailed guidance, check out the documentation. #AI #OpenSource #React #Vercel #Development

item.title: Introducing Vercel MCP: Connect Vercel to your AI tools
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Vercel has launched its MCP server, now in Public Beta. This secure interface allows AI tools to connect with your Vercel projects seamlessly. With Vercel MCP, tools like Cursor and Claude can access project logs, documents, and metadata directly, enhancing your workflow. Discover more about this innovative development! #Vercel #AIDevelopment #MCP #TechNews #DeveloperTools

item.title: Microfrontends support is now in Public Beta
item.description: üöÄ Microfrontends support is now in Public Beta! This feature allows developers to split large applications into smaller, manageable parts, enabling faster development and independent testing. Vercel simplifies the assembly and routing of these microfrontends into a cohesive user experience. To get started, users can clone examples from the Vercel dashboard, create microfrontend groups, and configure their projects with ease. For more details, check the documentation or contact Vercel support….

item.title: Claude Opus 4.1 is now supported in Vercel AI Gateway
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news! Claude Opus 4.1 is now accessible via Vercel’s AI Gateway without the need for additional provider accounts. This new model enhances task execution, coding, and reasoning compared to its predecessor. AI Gateway offers a unified API, usage tracking, and performance optimizations for improved reliability. Start using it with the AI SDK v5 by installing the package and setting the model to anthropic/claude-4.1-opus. Learn more about the AI Gateway and explore the new model…

item.title: gpt-oss-20b and gpt-oss-120b are now supported in Vercel AI Gateway
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news! Vercel AI Gateway now supports OpenAI’s gpt-oss-20b and gpt-oss-120b models. These open-weight reasoning models enhance access with a unified API, simplifying usage tracking and performance optimizations. üíª Developers can easily integrate them using AI SDK v5, with built-in observability and support for multiple model providers. Discover more about AI Gateway and check out the new model leaderboard! üìä #Vercel #OpenAI #AIModels #TechNews #Innovation

item.title: New custom visualization in Vercel Observability
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for Observability Plus users! You can now customize your data visualizations with options like line charts, volume charts, tables, or big numbers. üìä Both queries and visualization settings can be saved in shareable notebooks, enhancing teamwork. This update is available at no extra cost for Observability Plus teams. Explore the new features today! #DataVisualization #Observability #TechUpdate #Vercel #Collaboration

item.title: v0: vibe coding, securely
item.description: Vibe coding is transforming software development, allowing rapid prototyping with tools like v0. Anthropic’s CEO indicates that in just 3-6 months, 90% of code may be AI-generated. However, this speed can lead to significant risks. A recent incident involved a viral app that leaked 72,000 selfies and IDs due to misconfigured settings, emphasizing the need for security measures. #VibeCoding #SoftwareDevelopment #CyberSecurity #AI #TechNews üöÄüîíüì±

item.title: Vercel MCP now in Public Beta
item.description: üöÄ Vercel’s Model Control Protocol (MCP) server is now in Public Beta! The server, accessible at mcp.vercel.com, offers a remote interface with OAuth-based authorization, allowing secure interactions with AI tools and Vercel projects. It supports AI assistants like Claude.ai and integrates with tools such as VS Code to help manage projects, analyze deployment logs, and navigate documentation. This update aims to enhance collaboration between AI workflows and the Vercel ecosystem. For more…

item.title: A new wave of software, shipped on Vercel
item.description: üöÄ A new initiative, “Shipped on Vercel,” highlights innovative apps currently in production on the Vercel platform. This platform showcases teams that are reimagining web development, offering insights into their creative processes and technologies used. Discover how these real-world applications are shaping the future of the web! üåê #Vercel #WebDevelopment #Innovation #TechTrends #SoftwareDevelopment

item.title: Deploy Hono backends with zero configuration
item.description: üöÄ Vercel now offers native support for Hono, a lightweight backend framework, with zero configuration required. This integration allows Vercel to optimize Hono applications for builds and deployments, enhancing performance. New deployments benefit from features like Fluid compute, Active CPU pricing, and automatic cold start optimizations. For more details, check out Hono’s Vercel documentation. #Hono #Vercel #BackendDevelopment #WebStandards #TechUpdate

item.title: AI SDK 5
item.description: üöÄ The AI SDK 5 is making waves with over 2 million weekly downloads! This open-source toolkit for TypeScript and JavaScript offers a unified provider API, allowing developers to utilize any language model easily. It also supports powerful integrations with popular web frameworks. Explore the potential of AI SDK 5 for your projects! #AISDK #OpenSource #WebDevelopment #JavaScript #TypeScript

item.title: Vercel Open Source Program: Summer cohort
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news from Vercel! The Vercel Open Source Program has announced its summer 2025 cohort. This initiative supports developers by providing resources, credits, and assistance to enhance their projects. This season features 28 innovative projects, including AI-powered calendars and stylish React Native components. Learn more about these amazing contributions! #Vercel #OpenSource #DeveloperCommunity #Innovation #TechForGood
